questions.question_text: A user is planning to use AWS Cloudformation. Which of the below mentioned functionalities does not help him to correctly understand Cloudfromation?
questions.answer_description: AWS Cloudformation is an application management tool which provides application modelling, deployment, configuration, management and related activities. It supports a wide variety of AWS services, such as EC2, EBS, AS, ELB, RDS, VPC, etc. It also provides application bootstrapping scripts which enable the user to install software packages or create folders. It is free of the cost and only charges the user for the services created with it. The only challenge is that it does not follow any model, such as DevOps; instead customers can define templates and use them to provision and manage the AWS resources in an orderly way.

discussion.content: Correct Answer: A

questions.question_text:
A SysOps Administrator observes a large number of rogue HTTP requests on an Application Load Balancer (ALB). The requests originate from various IP addresses.
Which action should be taken to block this traffic?
questions.answer_description: AWS WAF has rules that can protect web applications from HTTP flood attacks.

discussion.content: D. Use AWS WAF rate-based blacklisting to block this traffic when it exceeds a defined threshold

Selected Answer: D
In this scenario, rate-based blacklisting is an effective approach to block the rogue HTTP requests. Rate-based blacklisting allows you to set a threshold for the number of requests from an IP address within a specified time frame. When the threshold is exceeded, AWS WAF can automatically block the IP address, preventing further malicious or excessive requests from reaching the web servers behind the ALB.
D. Use AWS WAF rate-based blacklisting to block this traffic when it exceeds a defined threshold

A company issued SSL certificates to its users, and needs to ensure the private keys that are used to sign the certificates are encrypted. The company needs to be able to store the private keys and perform cryptographic signing operations in a secure environment.
Which service should be used to meet these requirements?

choices.A: The S3 bucket must be configured with Amazon CloudFront first
choices.B: The Route 53 record set must have an IAM role that allows access to the S3 bucket
choices.C: The Route 53 record set must be in the same region as the S3 bucket
choices.D: The S3 bucket name must match the record set name in Route 53

comments.content: Also this supports answer as well. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/Route53/latest/DeveloperGuide/troubleshooting-s3-bucket-website-hosting.html

I think D https://docs.aws.amazon.com/Route53/latest/DeveloperGuide/RoutingToS3Bucket.html"

The bucket must have the same name as your domain or subdomain. For example, if you want to use the subdomain acme.example.com, the name of the bucket must be acme.example.com."

D, the S3 bucket name must match the record set name in Route 53
"The bucket must have the same name as your domain or subdomain. For example, if you want to use the subdomain acme.example.com, the name of the bucket must be acme.example.com." Refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/Route53/latest/DeveloperGuide/RoutingToS3Bucket.html

Selected Answer: D
When hosting a static website on Amazon S3 and routing traffic to it using Amazon Route 53, it is crucial that the S3 bucket name matches the record set name in Route 53. The record set in Route 53 should have the same name as the S3 bucket where the static website is hosted.

For example, if the S3 bucket name is "anycompany-static", the record set in Route 53 should have a name of "anycompany-static.example.com" or "anycompany-static.example.com." (with a trailing dot for the root domain).
